title: Rift in TMC: Kalyan Banerjee drags Moitra's personal life; takes 'honeymoon' jibe
content: Trinamool Congress MPs Kalyan Banerjee and Mahua Moitra are embroiled in another public dispute, this time over Banerjee's controversial remarks regarding the South Calcutta Law College rape case. Banerjee responded to Moitra's criticism by attacking her personal life, referencing her marriage and questioning her ethics.

title: Puri stampede: Two senior cops suspended, top officials transferred
content: A deadly stampede near the Gundicha Temple in Puri during the Rath Yatra festival resulted in three fatalities and over 50 injuries. The chaos, attributed to poor crowd management and unauthorized vehicles, drew sharp criticism and prompted a government investigation. Eyewitnesses reported confusion and inadequate response, while former CM Patnaik slammed the administration's incompetence following the tragedy.

title: MLC: Unmukt Chand is LAKR's lone bright spot, but will USA Cricket notice?
content: After struggling in the first two Major League Cricket (MLC) seasons, Unmukt Chand has finally found his feet in the US, where he moved to live his ultimate dream: ‚Äúto play for the US national team.‚Äù The right-handed batter has scored 243 runs in seven innings and is sixth on the list of top run-getters in the ongoing MLC 2025.

title: 'It's up to them': Owaisi keen on joining Mahagathbandhan in Bihar; says NDA must go
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has expressed his eagerness to join the Mahagathbandhan alliance for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections, aiming to prevent the BJP-led NDA from retaining power. Despite past unsuccessful attempts, AIMIM is ready to contest in Seemanchal and other regions, urging the opposition to unite against the NDA.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are ‚Ä¶
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: 'Found friends on foreign soil': Nostalgic reunion lights up Team India nets - Watch
content: During preparations for the second Test against England, the Indian cricket team enjoyed a heartwarming reunion at Edgbaston as familiar faces from home joined their net practice. Current and former teammates reminisced about their shared journey, strengthening bonds. Jasprit Bumrah's return to the nets raised hopes, while the team focused on improving lower-order batting.

title: Railways' 3 big ticketing changes: Charting, Tatkal, reservations explained
content: Indian Railways is set to introduce significant changes to its passenger reservation system, aiming to enhance passenger comfort. Key improvements include preparing reservation charts eight hours in advance, implementing verified user-only Tatkal ticket bookings with OTP authentication by July 2025, and launching a new passenger reservation system by December 2025.

title: IND v ENG: 'Bowling has to be ...' - Azhar urges India to reduce Bumrah dependency
content: Mohammad Azharuddin has cautioned India against over-relying on Jasprit Bumrah and suggested including Kuldeep Yadav for the second Test against England. He emphasised the need for a more varied bowling attack to support Bumrah. Azharuddin defended Shubman Gill's captaincy, urging patience and support for the new captain despite the team's batting collapse and defeat in the first Test.

title: Did Altman lie? Ex-OpenAI engineer joining Meta on $100M signing bonus
content: Lucas Beyer, a recent Meta hire from OpenAI, refuted claims of a $100 million signing bonus, dismissing them as "fake news." This follows Sam Altman's suggestion of Meta's extravagant offers to lure talent. Meta's CTO criticized Altman's tactics as dishonest, highlighting the ongoing talent war and Meta's significant AI investments.

title: PM Modi plays audio of Vajpayee, Desai to sharpen attack over Emergency
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Mann ki Baat address, recalled the Emergency imposed 50 years ago, terming it a dark chapter for Indian democracy. He stated that those who imposed it suppressed the judiciary and murdered the Constitution's spirit. Modi emphasized remembering those who fought against the Emergency to safeguard the Constitution.

title: IND vs ENG: Fined! England slapped with heavy penalty after 1st T20I defeat to India Women
content: England's women's cricket team has been fined a percentage of their match fee due to a slow over-rate during their first T20 International against India, where they suffered a significant 97-run defeat. The penalty issued by the ICC after the hosts were found to be two overs short of the required number.

title: Starlink launch: Spacex launches 27 satellites after storm delays
content: Despite severe weather warnings, SpaceX successfully launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying 27 Starlink satellites from Cape Canaveral. The launch coincided with the 10th anniversary of a Falcon 9 explosion, highlighting SpaceX's progress. The mission featured a reusable booster flying its fifth mission, landing successfully on the drone ship, demonstrating SpaceX's commitment to sustainable space travel.

title: US govt message to Visa applicants: From July 1, immigration agency to no longer send...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: 'The King': Parag hails Kohli as his inspiration; all-rounder reveals why
content: Riyan Parag, the emerging Indian all-rounder, considers Virat Kohli his cricketing inspiration, fondly calling him "The king who gave me my India cap." Kohli presented Parag with his ODI cap in August 2024, acknowledging his potential as a match-winner. Despite a modest debut, Parag's IPL performances and Kohli's encouragement have fueled his international aspirations.

title: Dwyane Wade, Union admit: 'We didn‚Äôt do it right' on child born during split
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, both previously married, have built a strong and enduring marriage. They attribute their success to learning from past mistakes, prioritizing open communication, and supporting each other's careers. Despite challenges, including a brief separation and Wade fathering a child with another woman, they've created a blended family and continue to thrive.

title: Rohit on Pant's 'fake injury' during T20 WC final: 'Genuinely thought ...'
content: India's T20 World Cup victory over South Africa in Barbados, a moment etched in history, saw Rohit Sharma's team end a 11-year ICC title drought. Sharma recently revealed Rishabh Pant's clever tactic during South Africa's chase. Pant's strategic pause, feigning a knee issue, disrupted South Africa's momentum, leading to a crucial wicket.

title: Blake Lively stops Swift from cutting her off as Kelce backs Taylor quietly
content: Blake Lively is reportedly struggling to salvage her friendship with Taylor Swift amidst the fallout from her legal issues with Justin Baldoni. As Travis Kelce distances himself from Ryan Reynolds, Lively is allegedly making desperate attempts to reconcile with Swift, even enlisting mutual friends for assistance. However, Swift's inner circle seems to be siding with her, leaving Lively's efforts uncertain.

title: Watch: 'Who broke my bat?' - Siraj fumes during practice before IND vs ENG 2nd Test
content: Ahead of the second Test against England, Mohammed Siraj practiced batting. Siraj found his bat broken. This caused a moment of surprise. The incident occurred during practice at Edgbaston. India aims to level the series after a defeat. Lower-order batting is a key concern for the team. Siraj's reaction to the broken bat showed his positive attitude.

title: IND v ENG: 'Far too defensive' - Ex-India cricketer urges captain Gill to be aggressive
content: Following India's defeat to England, Sanjay Manjrekar critiqued Shubman Gill's captaincy, suggesting he was overly defensive despite favourable conditions. Manjrekar contrasted Gill's approach with Virat Kohli's aggressive style. He lauded Rishabh Pant's form but cautioned KL Rahul against inconsistency. India, trailing 0-1, faces England in the second Test at Edgbaston.

title: Iran warns Israel may break ceasefire, says ‚Äòprepared to give strong response‚Äô
content: Iran's top military commander has voiced strong skepticism regarding Israel's adherence to the ceasefire agreement. He conveyed to Saudi Arabia's defense minister Tehran's readiness to retaliate forcefully should Israel resume hostilities. Despite not initiating the conflict, Iran asserts it responded with full force and remains prepared to do so again if necessary.

title: 24-year-old Indian woman goes missing in US; had gone for arranged marriage
content: Simran Simran, a 24-year-old woman from India, has been reported missing in New Jersey just days after arriving in the US for an arranged marriage. Surveillance footage shows her alone and seemingly waiting, but not distressed.

title: Shivakumar to be Karnataka CM? Congress MLA's big 2-3 months claim
content: Congress MLA H A Iqbal Hussain has ignited speculation about a potential leadership change in Karnataka, suggesting D K Shivakumar could become chief minister within months. Hussain emphasised Shivakumar's significant role in the party's victory and expressed confidence in the high command's decision-making. While dismissing claims of a revolution, he acknowledged the expectation for change.

title: 'I did marry a farmer': Hailee Steinfeld wants to trade glam for a garden
content: Following their recent wedding and honeymoon, Hailee Steinfeld is expressing a desire for a simpler life. She dreams of living on a farm, growing vegetables, and raising chickens. This vision aligns with Josh Allen's upbringing on a 2,000-acre farm in California, potentially making their shared dream a reality despite their high-profile careers.

title: Vinay Sapru recalls discovering Shefali Jariwala with Radhika Rao; Exclusive
content: Filmmaker Vinay Sapru, who along with Radhika Rao directed the iconic Kaanta Laga music video that turned Shefali Jariwala into an overnight sensation, has spoken exclusively to ETimes about the late star‚Äôs sudden passing and the unforgettable journey they shared.

title: 'Will I play again?': Rishabh Pant's painful question
content: Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant's remarkable recovery from a life-threatening car accident in December 2022 is truly inspiring. Orthopedic surgeon Dr. Dinshaw Pardiwala, who led Pant's treatment, revealed the extent of his injuries and the initial concerns about his ability to walk, let alone play cricket again.

title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre sorry‚Äô: Newborn left outside orphanage with handwritten note
content: In Panvel, a newborn girl was discovered abandoned outside an orphanage on Saturday morning. The infant was found with a feeding bottle, food, clothes, and a note from the parents expressing regret and citing financial and mental inability to care for her. The parents indicated a potential future return.

title: Wait ends: Monsoon reaches Delhi, envelops India 9 days early
content: The monsoon arrived in Delhi on June 29, 2025, a day earlier than expected, and covered the entire country nine days ahead of schedule. This is the fastest monsoon coverage since 2020. An orange alert has been issued for several districts in Himachal Pradesh due to heavy rainfall, with warnings of potential flash floods and landslides.

title: 'Shut down NTA': CUET UG 2025 result delay sparks nationwide outrage
content: The delay in CUET UG 2025 results has sparked national outrage, with students and educators criticizing the NTA's lack of communication and alleged mismanagement. Concerns about exam integrity and systemic failures, including unresponsive helplines, are intensifying calls for reform. Universities are facing disrupted academic calendars as they await the results to begin admissions.

title: Made videos, body-shamed girls: How 'Mango's' campus abuse was ignored for yrs
content: Manojit Mishra, accused of gang-rape, was known at his Kolkata law college for alleged abuse of power and instilling fear, particularly among women. He reportedly recorded private moments, morphed pictures, and shared them in WhatsApp groups for ridicule.

title: 'Even Virat Kohli was thinking ... ': Rohit Sharma on Kohli‚Äôs mental strength
content: Reflecting on India's T20 World Cup victory, Rohit Sharma highlighted Virat Kohli's pivotal 76-run innings and his crucial partnership with Axar Patel against South Africa. Sharma emphasized Kohli's experience and composure under pressure, which anchored the innings after early wickets fell.

title: Kolkata horror: 7-hr CCTV footage under lens; 90-second assault clip found
content: Kolkata Police have formed a Special Investigation Team to investigate the gang rape of a law student on her college campus. The team is analyzing CCTV footage and technical evidence, while the survivor's medical report confirms the assault. Three suspects, including an alumnus, have been arrested, and video clippings of the crime were retrieved from their phones.

title: CSK star batter creates history, smashes world record on Test debut
content: In a historic Test match against Zimbabwe, South Africa witnessed remarkable debuts. Dewald Brevis smashed the fastest fifty in a debut Test innings, while Lhuan-dre Pretorius became South Africa's youngest Test centurion, surpassing a 61-year-old record. Their performances highlighted the depth of young talent and validated South Africa's strategy of nurturing emerging cricketers.

title: Telangana horror: Man sets mother on fire over financial dispute
content: In a horrifying incident in Warangal, Muttineni Satish, an alcoholic, set his mother, Muttineni Vinoda, on fire after she refused to give him more money. Vinoda sustained 80% burns and is in critical condition. Satish had been harassing his parents for money after they received compensation for their land, leading to this brutal act.

title: Iran confirms 71 killed in Israeli strike on Evin prison; top prosecutor among the dead
content: An Israeli airstrike on Tehran's Evin prison, a facility notorious for holding political prisoners, resulted in at least 71 deaths, according to Iran's judiciary. The June 23 attack, part of a broader Israeli campaign against Iranian military infrastructure, killed inmates, guards, and civilians. Among the detainees are French citizens held on espionage charges.

title: Jake Paul dominates early rounds to beat Julio Cesar Chavez Jr in Anaheim
content: Jake Paul showcased a disciplined performance, securing a unanimous decision victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. in their California bout. Paul's aggressive jabs and body punches established his dominance early, overcoming Chavez Jr.'s experience. Despite late fatigue, Paul absorbed counters and eyes future fights against cruiserweight titleholders Gilberto Ramirez and Badou Jack, signaling his serious ambitions in boxing.

title: IND vs ENG: 'We never gave India...' - England cricketer on team's strategy
content: Jamie Smith revealed England's ruthless strategy following their impressive victory over India in Leeds, emphasizing the importance of capitalizing on dominance. Smith highlighted the team's maturity and ability to push their limits, citing examples of extraordinary performances. He also noted the impact of belief and support within the team, which has elevated his own game.

title: Landslides cut off villages; Char Dham yatra halted: Rain wreaks havoc in U'khand; 10 points
content: A cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi has caused significant damage, leaving workers missing and disrupting the Char Dham Yatra. The pilgrimage has been suspended for 24 hours due to heavy rain alerts and weather-related risks. Landslides have blocked the Badrinath and Yamunotri highways, stranding pilgrims and prompting urgent rescue operations by NDRF and SDRF teams.

title: Trade fallout: India's ban on Pak-origin cargo triggers spike in freight costs - Report
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India's ban on ships carrying goods from or to Pakistan has significantly disrupted Pakistani trade. This ban, effective May 2025, has led to increased freight charges and longer shipping times, forcing importers to rely on feeder vessels. Indian agencies are actively enforcing the ban, seizing falsely declared Pakistani goods routed through third countries.

title: 'Make deal in Gaza': Trump calls for ceasefire; urges Hamas to release hostages
content: Donald Trump urged Israel and Hamas to finalize a deal for the release of hostages taken on October 7th, emphasizing the urgency of their return. This appeal follows Trump's previous call to drop the case against Netanyahu, whom he praised as a "War Hero," suggesting the legal proceedings could hinder negotiations.

title: Russia launches biggest air attack since war began, says Ukraine ‚Äî 537 weapons used
content: Russia launched its largest aerial assault on Ukraine, deploying 537 aerial weapons, including drones and missiles, targeting regions across the country. Ukrainian forces reported shooting down 249 of the incoming weapons, while others were lost, likely due to electronic jamming. The extensive attack prompted Poland and allied nations to scramble aircraft to safeguard their airspace, highlighting the escalating conflict's impact.

title: Kumar Vishwas on ‚ÄòSardaar Ji 3‚Äô controversy: Slams Diljit Dosanjh
content: Renowned Hindi poet and former politician Kumar Vishwas recently addressed the rising criticism surrounding Diljit Dosanjh-starrer 'Sardaar Ji 3'. The film has drawn flak for featuring Pakistani actress Hania Aamir, particularly in the aftermath of the India-Pak tensions since April 2025.

title: 'I made your name': Ex-England cricketer on Tendulkar vs Kohli
content: Allan Lamb, the former England cricketer, declared Sachin Tendulkar as the best Indian batter, even placing him above Sunil Gavaskar and Virat Kohli. Lamb humorously recalls dropping Tendulkar early in his career, jokingly claiming responsibility for his success.

title: Kolkata horror: Prime accused's one-liner for every girl - 'Tui amay biye korbi?'
content: Monojit Mishra, accused of rape, displayed a history of disturbing behavior, including circulating morphed images, filming private moments, and body-shaming women. Despite multiple complaints of harassment and assault, no action was taken against him, fostering a climate of fear. Students describe him as a terror, highlighting the college's failure to address his actions due to his political connections.

title: ‚ÄòBharat Mata‚Äô row: Kerala University Vice-Chancellor rejects Registrar‚Äôs explanation of attempt to cancel event
content: Registrar said he attempted to cancel the booking of the hall since the organisers of the event, which marked the anniversary of Emergency, had breached the terms of the contract by displaying religious symbols

title: Bengaluru‚Äôs Pink Line metro stretch moves a step forward as third rail testing begins on elevated section
content: This marks the beginning of a series of mandatory trials ahead of the corridor‚Äôs eventual commissioning

title: Chittoor police to conduct Slow Motorcycle Riding competition next month
content: Aim of the event is to promote public awareness on traffic regulations and discipline among motorists; All skilled riders possessing valid driving licenses can participate in the competition to be held next month

title: Kerala ex-cop‚Äôs 2,025-km pedal push against drug abuse
content: With an aim to take the fight against drug abuse straight to the streets, schools and hearts of the youth, Shahjahan launched a 2,025-km solo ride across all 14 districts of Kerala.

title: AI-powered cameras to be installed on Karnataka highways to curb accidents and violations
content: A ‚Çπ70-crore project will be implemented in three phases and is aimed at enhancing road safety using cutting-edge technology

title: Mid-term elections likely in Karnataka before Dasara, says BJP leader Sriramulu
content: Congress government is corrupt and bankrupt, and will surely fall amid confusion over transfer of power, he says

title: Watch: Shashi Tharoor and his differences with Congress Party | Talking Politics
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss Congress MP Shashi Tharoor and his differences with the party and Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge over his remarks about PM Modi

title: Mahagathbandhan will throw Waqf Act into dustbin after forming government in Bihar: Tejashwi
content: Young leader addresses ‚ÄòSave Waqf, Save Constitution‚Äô rally, opposing NDA government‚Äôs Waqf Act, emphasising democracy and pluralism

title: Kerala Congress (M) to submit 16-point plan for Meenachil to CM
content: Plan calls for interventions ranging from the restoration of streams and wetlands to structural and regulatory reforms

title: Bangalore University implements geotagged photos of examiners in practical exams to ensure transparency, accountability
content: Each semester, at least nine practical exams must be conducted per college, across 128 affiliated colleges, serving approximately 15,500 BCA students. The new software can help eliminate manual intervention, while improving efficiency and integrity, say officials.

title: Nearly half of central funds for border bunkers in J&K lie unused, reveals RTI
content: While 7,298 bunkers were sanctioned for the population along the LoC in the twin districts of Poonch and Rajouri, 7,162 underground bunkers got approved for villages along the IB in Jammu, Kathua and Samba districts.

title: Tejashwi ducks as drone crashes into podium at Patna rally
content: Former deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav narrowly avoids drone crash during rally in Patna; police investigating incident

title: Kolkata gang rape: Trinamool Congress issues show cause notice to MLA Madan Mitra for ‚Äòinsensitive comments‚Äô
content: ‚ÄúYour (Mitra) uncalled for and insensitive comments on June 28 has affected our party‚Äôs image,‚Äù the party said in the show cause notice

title: Amit Shah asks Maoists to drop guns and join mainstream as naxals would be eliminated by March 2026
content: Union Home Minister said those who want to surrender can surrender and join the mainstream like thousands of militants did in the North East to join the political mainstream

title: ‚ÄòRed alert‚Äô for downpour in Himachal; Shimla-Kalka rail line shut after overnight rains
content: Of the 12 districts, a red alert for downpour has been issued for 10 district -- Bilapsur, Hamirpur, Kangra, Mandi, Shimla, Solan, Sirmaur, Una, Kullu and Chamba -- for June 29.

title: Alleged custodial death in Sivaganga: Edappadi Palaniswami demands judicial probe, compensation
content: The former Chief Minister condemned M.K. Stalin for his alleged inability to administer the police force.

title: Topuria KO's Oliveira cold, now 2-division champ
content: Ilia Topuria needed just one round to finish Charles Oliveira, knocking him out cold to capture the vacant lightweight title in the UFC 317 main event.

title: Paul easily tops Chavez, calls for 'tougher fighters'
content: Jake Paul's unlikely rise through the boxing ranks continued with a unanimous decision win over former WBC middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr., saying afterward that he wants "to be a world champion."

title: Parker, 2-time WS champ, 7-time All-Star, dies
content: Dave Parker, a two-time World Series champion and seven-time MLB All-Star, has died at the age of 74.

title: Sources: Batum opts out; interest in Clips return
content: There is mutual interest between Nicolas Batum and the Clippers in a new deal together after the veteran forward opted out, sources told ESPN.

title: 'A joke': Chelsea coach slams CWC weather delays
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca questioned the choice of the U.S. as host of the Club World Cup and branded the two-hour weather delay in his team's win over Benfica as "a joke."

title: Elliott uses last lap to post 'unbelievable' win
content: Home-state favorite Chase Elliott passed Brad Keselowski on the final lap and won the the crash-filled NASCAR Cup Series at Atlanta for his 20th career victory, saying afterward that "this is something I'll remember the rest of my life."

title: Hall of Famer Wilkens feted with statue in Seattle
content: Lenny Wilkens, the legendary former SuperSonics player, coach and executive, was honored as the first person to have a statue unveiled outside Climate Pledge Arena in Seattle.

content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

content: Inter Miami defied expectations by reaching the round of 16 at the Club World Cup. Now comes the really hard part: a date with the European champions ... and Messi's former club.

title: Luis Enrique: PSG can't relax vs. best ever Messi
content: Paris Saint-Germain manager Luis Enrique warned his players against ignoring the offensive threats of Lionel Messi and Inter Miami in Sunday's Club World Cup match.

title: Mexico into Gold Cup semis as Mora makes history
content: Alexis Vega scored the crucial opening goal early in the second half to help Mexico to a 2-0 win over Saudi Arabia in the Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Klopp: Expanded Club World Cup the worst idea
content: Former Liverpool manager J√ºrgen Klopp has criticised the introduction of the expanded Club World Cup format, calling it the worst idea ever implemented in football.

title: Poch hails 'great' Navas ahead of Gold Cup reunion
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino hailed Costa Rica goalkeeper Keylor Navas as "one of the best in the world" ahead of Sunday's Gold Cup quarterfinal.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree to sign Gittens; 7-yr deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth up to ‚Ç¨65 million ($76.1m) to sign Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ronaldo: Saudi league already top 5 in the world
content: Cristiano Ronaldo preferred to take a rest rather than play in the revamped Club World Cup, he said on Saturday after renewing his contract with Al Nassr.

title: Schmelzel, Valenzuela team up to take Dow lead
content: Sarah Schmelzel and Albane Valenzuela took a one-shot lead Saturday in the Dow Championship after shooting a 2-under 68 in alternate-shot play.

content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

content: Leader of Opposition in the Legislative Council Ambadas Danve of the Shiv Sena (UBT) said the boycott is a mark of protest against a ‚Äúdishonest Government‚Äù

title: First phase of the Census with Houselisting operations to begin from April 1, 2026
content: In a letter to Chief Secretaries of States and Union Territories, Census Commissioner and Registrar General of India Mrityunjay Kumar Narayan said the Houselisting Operations and Housing Census shall begin on April 1, 2026.

title: After 18-year battle with genetic heart disease, 41-year-old Bengaluru resident gets transplant
content: A marketing manager by profession, Mohammed Rafi ‚Äî who hails from Kerala ‚Äî was diagnosed with Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM) at the age of 23.

content: Kamal Haasan‚Äôs exceptional command over every aspect of filmmaking as a writer, singer, director, producer, and actor is truly inspiring. He is a true master of the craft, says Pawan Kalyan

content: The incident has caught the TTD authorities off guard, as it is unprepared for such a void, in the absence of a successor to the snake catcher

content: The establishment of the Turmeric Board has been a major demand of the turmeric farmers in Nizamabad and it was also a key election issue.

content: The AAP national convener alleged that the Rekha Gupta-led Delhi government had "ruined" the city in the past five months.

content: According to the revised notification, polling for the three-tier panchayat elections will be held in two phases on July 24 and 28 and the counting of votes will take place on July 31

content: Opening of highways and rehabilitation of internally displaced persons are on the agenda for discussion

title: Raghavendra Mutt seer initiates construction of golden chariot in Udupi
content: The new chariot is being constructed to have chariot ceremonies throughout the year in Krishna Mutt premises.

title: Life threat to PMK functionaries supporting Ramadoss: MLA Arul
content: Dr. Ramadoss made Anbumani the party president three years ago. When Mr. Anbumani claims that his father was giving postings to people with criminal records and roadside vendors, how was it valid, questioned the MLA.

content: Thoothukudi Collector K. Elambahavath told that a Coast Guard vessel had reached the stranded boats and rescued them from the Sri Lankan waters. The vessels are expected to reach Thoothukudi by June 30

content: 162 students of Lav Kush Residential School were trapped in the school since June 28 night after the premises got flooded due to heavy rain

title: Tamil Nadu government decides not to extend Rosewood Conservation Act
content: Initially passed for 15 years in 1995, the Act was renewed in 2010 for another 15-year period to prevent the illegal felling and trade of the trees. However, the government has decided that continuing the Act is no longer necessary

title: Nine labourers go missing in landslip triggered by cloudburst in Uttarkashi
content: A team rushed to the spot and found that labourers engaged in road construction work lived there by putting up tents. They are feared to have been swept away by heavy rain

title: Jaipur Couple Seen Arguing On CCTV, Found Dead At Their House A Day Later
content: A married couple was found dead at their home in Jaipur's Muhana in a suspected case of death by suicide. The police said they are looking into all angles, including murder. The bodies were found on Friday.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu's "Make Middle East Great Again" Call After Trump's Support On Corruption Trial
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanked US President Donald Trump for extending support over the corruption trial against him, as he pleaded to "make the Middle East great again" with the American leader.

title: Tejashwi Yadav Ducks As Drone, Employed To Cover Rally, Strays, Hits  Podium
content: Tejashwi Yadav was mid-speech in Patna on Sunday when a drone, which was deployed to cover his rally, appeared to stray from its intended path and veered towards him, shows a video.

title: First Phase Of Census With Houselisting Operations To Begin From April 1, 2026
content: The houselisting operations for the forthcoming Census will begin from April 1, 2026, marking the start of the first phase of the decennial exercise, the Registrar General of India has said.

title: 162 Students Trapped In Jharkhand School After Heavy Rain, Rescued
content: At least 162 students trapped in an inundated private residential school in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district after heavy rain were rescued by the police on Sunday, a senior officer said.

title: Woman's Body Stuffed Into Sack, Dumped In Garbage Truck In Bengaluru
content: The body of a woman, estimated to be in the 30-35 years age group, was stuffed into a sack and dumped in a garbage truck in Bengaluru.

title: Man, 45, Wanted To Marry. Newly-Wed Wife Murdered Him For 18-Acre Land
content: A deep sense of frustration over not finding a bride followed by a viral public appeal ended in the death of a 45-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh, after a woman forged her identity to marry him and then killed him to seize his property.

title: 477 Drones, 60 Missiles: Russia Launches "Biggest" Aerial Attack On Ukraine
content: Russia launched its biggest aerial attack against Ukraine overnight, wounding at least six people, including a child, according to Ukrainian officials.

title: "Honeymoon" Reply To "Misogyny" Barb: Kolkata Rape Widens Trinamool Rift
content: The rape of a law student at a Kolkata college has brought infighting in the ruling Trinamool Congress out in the open as party leaders take potshots at each other.

title: 3 Earthquakes Hit Pakistan In 24 Hours, No Reports Of Major Damages
content: Pakistan is one of the most seismically active countries in the world, being crossed by several major faults.

title: Newborn Girl Found Dumped In Basket In Navi Mumbai, 'Sorry' Note Recovered
content: A local resident on Saturday alerted the police about the baby lying in a blue coloured basket on a roadside at Takka Colony in Panvel area of Navi Mumbai.

title: 2 Dead, 7 Missing After Uttarakhand Cloudburst, Char Dham Yatra Suspended
content: At least two labourers were killed and seven others went missing after a cloudburst triggered a landslide in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district early Sunday.

title: Monsoon Arrives In Delhi, Covers Entire Country 9 Days Early: Weather Office
content: According to the weather office data, this is the earliest the monsoon has covered the entire country since 2020 when it did so by June 26.

title: Under BJD Attack, Chief Minister's "Seek Forgiveness" Post On Puri Stampede
content: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Manjhi has taken responsibility for the stampede during the Jagannath Rath Yatra in Puri, which claimed three lives and sought forgiveness from devotees

title: Chennai-Bound Air India Flight Returned To Mumbai After "Burning Smell"
content: A Chennai-bound Air India flight returned to Mumbai on Friday after a burning smell was detected inside the cabin, the airline said on Sunday.

title: Taliban Claims Waziristan Suicide Bombing As Pakistan Blames India
content: At least 16 security officials were killed on Saturday in a suicide bombing in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. Islamabad has blamed New Delhi for the attack that also left over two dozen people, including civilians, wounded.

title: Why UN Nuclear Watchdog Thinks Iran Could Again Enrich Uranium Within "Months"
content: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the United Nations' nuclear watchdog, has warned Iran would likely be able to resume producing enriched uranium within months, despite damage to several nuclear facilities from US and Israeli attacks.

title: "Those Who Fought Emergency Should Always Be Remembered": PM Modi On Mann Ki Baat
content: Speaking in his Mann Ki Baat radio broadcast, PM Modi said those who imposed the Emergency not only murdered the Constitution but also made judiciary their puppet.

title: 2 Astronauts, 2 Prime Ministers, 1 India: A Cosmic Leap 41 Years Apart
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, speaking from the International Space Station (ISS), looked down upon the subcontinent and said, "Jab pehli baar Bharat ko dekha, Bharat sach mein bohat bhavya dikhta hain."
